metadata.title: CVE-2021-32052 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In Django 2.2 before 2.2.22, 3.1 before 3.1.10, and 3.2 before 3.2.2 (withPython 3.9.5+), URLValidator does not prohibit newlines and tabs (unlessthe URLField form field is used). If an application uses values withnewlines in an HTTP response, header injection can occur. Django itself isunaffected because HttpResponse prohibits newlines in HTTP headers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-django - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.17
python-django-common - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.17
python3-django - 1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-django package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.11.11-1ubuntu1.17').
